body:
Comment 5: 
Some programs run slower with multiple cores because the synchronization operations are
more expensive. If the problem is not intrinsically parallel, it's sure to run slower.
Even if it has some parallelism, the expense of synchronization may dominate.  See
http://blog.golang.org/concurrency-is-not-parallelism
_Labels changed: added **priority-someday**, **performance**, removed **priority-triage**._ _Status changed to **WontFix**._
